intro: Eschscholzia compacta, commonly known as the dwarf California poppy, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its bright orange to red flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters and has smooth, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, often found in dry, open areas. The flowers bloom from spring to summer and are known for their simple, showy structure.
